main event: A bright, fiery orange object was observed traveling at a high rate of speed over Ponca City, Oklahoma on August 13, 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as round, about the size of a basketball held at arm's length, with a tail approximately 1 inch long.
The object made no sound and disappeared suddenly as if its bright light was turned off.
The observer was unsure if the object was a satellite, meteor, or something else, but did not believe it was a meteor.
Weather conditions at the time were fair and clear, with no unusual meteorological or astronomical activity detected.
No interception or identification actions were taken, and the Civil Aeronautics Center had no record of the sighting.
